structural_unit_name.en: School of Economics and Business Administration

description.en: During Master Seminar the participants get both theoretical and practical skills for writing their Master Thesis. Via practical tasks the students get support for choosing research topic, planning the structure and research process of the thesis.
description.et: Magistriseminaris antakse osalejatele teoreetilisi teadmisi ja praktilisi oskusi magistritöö koostamiseks. Praktiliste ülesannete raames toetatakse üliõpilasi magistritöö teema valikul, struktuuri ja uurimisprotsessi kavandamisel.

objectives.en: The aim of the Master Seminar is to explain and systematize the basic knowledge and research methods for completing the Master Thesis. During Master Seminar necessary presentation, reviewing and discussion skills are developed.
objectives.et: Magistriseminari eesmärgiks on selgitada ja süstematiseerida põhiteadmisi ja uurimismeetodeid, mis on vajalikud magistritöö koostamiseks. Magistriseminari käigus arendatakse vajalikke esinemis-, retsenseerimis- ja diskussioonioskusi.

learning_outcomes.en:
After the course is passed the participant:
*knows the requirements for completion the Master Thesis at this faculty
*knows the basic research methods and their implementation in economic field
*can formulate research problem, aim of the study and research tasks
*can compile short research syllabus and plan research process
*is able to find theoretical literature and can write a literature overview
*can collect data for empirical research and analyse them
*knows how to interpret both theoretical and empirical material, and make generalizations
*can make a presentation of Master thesis' results and discuss them

notes.et: Option of RPL for the Master's seminar course (2 ECTS) is subject to the approval of the course responsible.

description.et:
Assignment 1: Finding the key points of a published article. 
1.	The students will be given published articles. 
2.	Each student has to identify the important points of the article: motivation, aim, thesis statement, research question, novelty, structure, main findings, further research proposals.
3.	The student has to prepare a report that lists these points.

Assignment 2: Search in databases and Zotero
1.	Perform searches on your own topic in Business Source Complete and in Web of Science or Scopus.
2.	Transfer relevant results to Zotero to different folders, so that you have a separate folder for each database. Perform screenshots from open Zotero folders, each of them containing at least 3 relevant records.
3.	Create in-text citations to these items and present a bibliography of at least 6 records using the reference style of your own choice. You can find the instructions in Zotero Documentation (https://www.zotero.org/support/start) under Generating Bibliographies, Citations, and Reports - Word Processor Integration. 
4.	Submit (click on Add a new discussion topic) your assignment to the course forum Zotero.

Assignment 3: The extended research plan (incl presentation).
The extended research plan should consist of the following parts:
1.	Topicality of the subject - why this problem is important. Identify the research gap, the problem that is interesting but not yet addressed. Defining a clear research question
2.	The aim of a research paper. The aim of a research paper should give a clear perception of what will be achieved with this research. It should not be presented in terms of activity (avoid phrases like to analyse, to research, to give an overview), but in terms of expected outcomes or results.
3.	Literature Review (theoretical background). It should be explained which theoretical approaches will be used in the research paper. Extended research plan should demonstrate that you have already read some pieces of relevant literature (at least 10). It should contain viewpoints from the main sources you are going to use, and these need to be clearly referenced.
4.	Plans for empirical part. It should convince the reader that you use an appropriate method. Which method and data suit best to your particular research question? Are there any problems foreseen with the data deficiency and how to solve it?
5.	Planned structure of MA thesis
6.	List of references

grade_preconditions.et:
To pass the MA seminar students need to:
a) complete all the assignments (finding keypoints of an article, search in databases and extended research plan)
b) participate actively in seminars.
Non-differentiated assessment will be used for both assignments (pass/fail).

grade_evaluation.et: Failure to do any of the three assignments would result in the failure from the course.

debt_elimination.et: To retake the course next year.

name.en: Chair of International Business and Innovation

description.et: Opening seminar: General requirements for MA thesis. The writing process. Structure and the main parts of MA thesis. Seminar by Hakan Eratalay.

Search in databases: Principles of information search in databases. Overview of databases open for the UT. Using databases from outside the university network. Seminar by Signe Bachmann and Vilve Seiler.

Reference management with Zotero: What does Zotero do? Installing Zotero; Zotero preferences. Adding items to Zotero from databases and web pages. Adding in-text citations and creating bibliographies with Zotero. Seminar by Signe Bachmann and Vilve Seiler.
Writing a master thesis in the form of an academic article. Seminar by Oliver Lukason
Presentation of extended research plan. Seminar by Hakan Eratalay

audience.et: Master´s Thesis Module, Innovation and Technology Management 2nd year
